Meaning: codes for initiator and participants within Conversation block

Meaning: dominant speaker in second; if both spkrs were half second, both concatenated (eg, NOFOLN)
proportion of second which speaker was MAN: Male Adult Near
proportion of second which speaker was MAF: Male Adult Faint
proportion of second which speaker was FAN: Female Adult Near
proportion of second which speaker was FAF: Female Adult Faint
proportion of second which speaker was CHN: target Child Near
proportion of second which speaker was CHF: target Child Faint
proportion of second which speaker was CXN: other Child Near
proportion of second which speaker was CXF: other Child Faint
proportion of second which speaker was NON: Noise Near
proportion of second which speaker was NOF: Noise Faint
proportion of second which speaker was OLN: Overlap Near
proportion of second which speaker was OLF: Overlap Far
proportion of second which speaker was TVN: Electronic/TV Near
proportion of second which speaker was TVF: Electronic/TV Faint
proportion of second which speaker was SIL: Silence
proportion of second which speaker was OFF: DLP off
